intro: Euphrasia jacutica, commonly known as the Jacutian eyebright, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that range in color from yellow to reddish-brown. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in alpine or subalpine environments. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are clustered in racemes. Euphrasia jacutica is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies for various ailments.
